channel.title: External Ip Problem
channel.description:
Can run the server locally but can not run it on my external ip i get this below and it closes please do not call me a noob i know how to run a server open ports edit config files.... etcetc
Just need bit help on whats going on.
[img]http://img143.imageshack.us/img143/3038/helpwq6.png[/img]
any ideas?

item.title: External Ip Problem
item.dc:creator: @utdfc4life utdfc4life
item.description:
@utdfc4life wrote:

hey guys im having the same trouble except in the bat file it dont do tht…it runs but other people cannot connect to my server and plz can sum1 tell me how to make my server so tht other people can connect…thnx

item.title: External Ip Problem
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“Cake2, post:11, topic:234683”]I still lol @ you

I’ve ended them i’ve used the bat file. it still does it, So yeah.

yoru wrong again and i will keep saying your wrong.

oh and i knew you would bring up xEnt name you must be up his arse still.[/quote]It’s spelled you’re you fucking idiot. I am not wrong, it can’t assign the address because it’s in use by a java.exe process. And no, I brought up xEnt because he actually knows how to code and doesn’t pretend to know how to like retards like you do. Just GTFO of these forums, nobody wants you here anyways. By the way, if I’m wrong, I’d like to see you explain to me what a bind error in java is.

Keep saying what you want, but 1084 is only right about the first part. You’re just saying that he is right because I proved how stupid you really are. Also, if I’m wrong, how do I have 45 rep and you only have 10 rep?
Edit: No response. What a surprise. Fucking idiot.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Cake2 wrote:

I still lol @ you

I’ve ended them i’ve used the bat file. it still does it, So yeah.

yoru wrong again and i will keep saying your wrong.

oh and i knew you would bring up xEnt name you must be up his arse still.

oh and btw what 1084 said works people can now connect to the server unlucky.

Read full topic

item.title: External Ip Problem
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“Cake2, post:8, topic:234683”]Just edited the configs to what you told me and changed the ip to 192.168.1 blahblah its loaded up now i will let you know later tonight when i get the other guy thats helping me to test it out.

and bigh51 you oviously know shit. Every time i ended java.exe inside task manager it still gave me the bind crap so before you give out insults stfu.[/quote]Okay, first of all, if you ended java.exe in the task manager, make sure you ended ALL of them AND closed the command prompt window. I do know “shit”, ask anyone such as xEnt or extacy or another person that actually knows something about coding and doesn’t pretend to and they will say that I DO know “shit”. You obviously didn’t end ALL of the java.exes you only ended the client’s java.exe process and not the servers. Also, smart guy, it’s spelled “obviously” not “oviously”. Go back to grade 4.

Read full topic

item.title: External Ip Problem
item.dc:creator: @_Kyle ~Kyle
item.description:
@_Kyle wrote:

taskkill /F /IM java.exe Theres a simple batch file. Save it as killjava.bat
So you don’t got to bring up task manager all the time, you can just click it & it’ll be all good.

Read full topic

item.title: External Ip Problem
item.dc:creator: @Cake2 Cake2
item.description:
@Cake2 wrote:

Just edited the configs to what you told me and changed the ip to 192.168.1 blahblah its loaded up now i will let you know later tonight when i get the other guy thats helping me to test it out.

and bigh51 you oviously know shit. Every time i ended java.exe inside task manager it still gave me the bind crap so before you give out insults stfu.

Read full topic

item.title: External Ip Problem
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“1408, post:4, topic:234683”]bind normally means you have that port already inuse. Idk much about the rscd source, but im sure that i means that ur java.exe didnt close. or it could possibly mean that ur going through a router. your router has the ports open but you must use the local ip. you can make the ip of the server in the world.xml ur 192.168..** this will allow the outside traffic to connect via your acutal external ip. you will need to set up that those ports will be routed to that ip. and it should work.[/quote]“routered to that ip.”… Wow, you clearly don’t know anything about what you’re talking about. Me and elyad helped before 1408 did, and 1408 gave faulty information. Bind means that the java.exe process is using the port, and needs to be ended in task manager. Don’t thank 1408, thank me and elyad. /endthread.

Read full topic

item.title: External Ip Problem
item.description:
@1408 wrote:

bind normally means you have that port already inuse. Idk much about the rscd source, but im sure that i means that ur java.exe didnt close. or it could possibly mean that ur going through a router. your router has the ports open but you must use the local ip. you can make the ip of the server in the world.xml ur 192.168..** this will allow the outside traffic to connect via your acutal external ip. you will need to set up that those ports will be routed to that ip. and it should work.

Read full topic

item.title: External Ip Problem
item.dc:creator: @elyad elyad
item.description:
@elyad wrote:

Yeah, bind address means your server is already running in the background, ctrl+alt+del and end all java applications.

Read full topic

item.title: External Ip Problem
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

If you can run a server, how come you don’t know that a bind error means the server is already running? You are a noob and a newb.

Read full topic
